author: OKFN
name: nicaragua-oda-database
notes:
ODAnic is the online database of Official Development Assistance (ODA) from development partners to Nicaragua.

## Details
The database was created in response to the Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness. In 2007, the UK’s Department for International Development (DFID) initiated and supported the establishment of ODAnic. This new and improved version of ODAnic is a product of the Development Gateway.

ODAdata - an aid information management system of the Development Gateway- set up the database. Ownership not explicitly stated. On Development Gateway site: "Country Gateways are independent entities that are locally owned and operated." (http://www.developmentgateway.org/programs/country-gateway-support/frequently-asked-questions.html#4)

extras.value: Pretty easy and intuitive to use. Alot of metadata for the site is hidden in the appendix of the ODAnic manual. Budget output in a number of currancies. Some of the data is in Spanish.

Not all fields filled in for some projects. 
Earliest start date is 1995, but could well be missing projects completed before 2007 when the data was first collected.

Donor, Donor Agency, Project Number, OECD ID, Recipient Country Budget Number, Project Title, Project Description, Country Strategy Link, Project Status, Start date, End date, Total Commitments, Total Disbursements, Funds for 2007, Funds for 2008, Funds for 2009, Funds for 2010, Funds for 2011, Funds for 2012, Co-Funding Totals, Co-Funding Donors, National/Regional Program, Type of Implementation, DAC Sector, Aid Modality, Grant/Loan, Implementing Agencies, Contracted Agencies, Rio & Policy Markers, MDG Goals, Focal Regions, Officer Responsible, Internet link, Comments, Last Update.

The database was created in response to the Paris Declaration on Aid Effectiveness. In 2007, the UK’s Department for International Development (DFID) initiated and supported the establishment of ODAnic. This new and improved version of ODAnic is a product of the Development Gateway.

ODAdata - an aid information management system of the Development Gateway- set up the database. Ownership not explicitly stated. On Development Gateway site: "Country Gateways are independent entities that are locally owned and operated." (http://www.developmentgateway.org/programs/country-gateway-support/frequently-asked-questions.html#4)

Austria, Canada, Denmark, European Commission, Finland, France, Germany, Iceland, Inter American Development Bank, Italy, Japan, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom, United Nations, United States, World Bank.
Not explicitly stated, most likely Development Gateway
ODAnic is the online database of Official Development Assistance (ODA) from development partners to Nicaragua.

Donor countries responsible for keeping the database up to date. Development Gateway responsible for data quality checking, adminsitration and training. Local partner Xolo (http://www.xolo.com.ni/) responsible for system maintainance.
Data provided on to a web form linked to ODAnic database
Development Gateway responsible for data quality checking.
Millenium gateway complient. DAC and MDG sectors.
Official Development Assistance to Nicaragua Database (ODAnic)
